newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Jamaica four-month trade gap widens.
newsitem.headline: Jamaica four-month trade gap widens.

text.p: Jamaica's trade deficit grew by US$50 million, or 11.6 percent, in the first four months of 1997 compared a year earlier, to US$476.4 million, the government said Monday.
Imports rose 1.7 percent to US$925.9 million from US$910.4 million, and exports fell 7.1 percent to US$466.3 million from $483.7 million, it said.
Raw materials and intermediate goods imports declined 8 percent, while consumer imports rose 12.6 percent.
The trade deficit has set new record highs in three of the past four years, and April figures set yet another record, the government said.
